peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is jimping on a knife?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The two most common methods of adding jumping are using a bandsaw/file combination and a Dremel/file combination to achieve professional-quality results. Jimping is the process of cutting small notches or filings into the back of a knife blade or on the unsharpened area between the blade and the hilt of the knife.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How To Add Jimping To A Knife | Red Label Abrasives

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is considered a vintage knife?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Generally speaking, an art knife that is not more than 25 years old is considered Contemporary. An art knife that is between 25 and 50 years old would be considered Vintage. An Art Knife between 50 and 75 years old would be considered Semi-antique and an art knife older than 75 years would be considered Antique.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How to Spot Authentic Vintage Knives for Sale
